reviews.text: Truly enjoyable!
Everything was amazing! The ribs with zereshk and date salad were incredible.
We enjoyed the food and the service. Atmosphere didn't talk much to the Persian culture.

The food here brings satisfaction with every visit. The team maintained efficiency without losing friendliness. Their food stays reliable. Super friendly service and relaxing vibe. The spot provides excellent quality.
Phenomenal food
I have come back here twice in one month over the summer. And can't wait to come back again. Such a perfect meal with friends.

We booked this restaurant three months in advance for our NYC trip and it was absolutely worth the wait. If youâ€™re visiting New York, this is a must-go. Every bite tasted like heaven.

Itâ€™s Persian food made with care, creativity, and love.
Eyval you got 10/10 from a Persian couple visiting from Melbourne, Australia.
Thank you
Sanaz

We went to Eyval for dinner and found parking without much trouble. The place had a nice energy with a modern look and a comfortable crowd.

The kitchen was fast and the food was excellent. The ghorme sabzi had deep flavor and tender meat. The tahdig was golden and crisp, and the kabob was juicy and well seasoned with saffron rice and grilled tomatoes.

The servers, however, werenâ€™t very attentive. Drinks sat empty for a while, and it took some effort to get their attention. For two people, the total was about $120, which felt fair for the quality.

Overall, Eyval delivers top Persian food and a great vibe, but the service could be more engaged to match the kitchenâ€™s pace.

So i tried kashk bademjoo,mast moosir
Barbari and koobide ,koobide was dry and had weird taste but kashk bademjoon was not bad
Everything was great
Every single item on the menu is amazing!
I brought my friends from California and they loved it. They actually made me leave this review since they had such a great time.

I was wowed. Iâ€™ve had lots of Persian food but this was different. Some of the better interpretations of this food Iâ€™ve ever had. The chicken was some of the best chicken dishes Iâ€™ve had, and donâ€™t get me started on the lamb ribs. Truly recommended.
Super nice experience.  Great service and food timing was perfect.  No rushing.
Loved it! The dishes were so tasty - 10/10
Phenomenal, modern take on classic Iranian dishes. We ordered almost the whole menu and werenâ€™t disappointed by a single thing. One of the best dining experiences of my life.
meh
One of the best restaurants Iâ€™ve been to in New York. The flavors are incredible. The whipped feta, date salad and wagyu skewers were excellent. Absolutely coming back

Supper yummy but supper greasy!

Worth going once in a while.

This was one of the most disappointing experiences Iâ€™ve had recently. While the food was delicious, the service was horrendous. Not only was Service very slow in our server only managed to check in on us once throughout the whole meal, After we had finished everything we ordered, we decided we needed one more entrÃ©e to feel fully satiated as the portions were a lot smaller than we expected. At that time, our server informed us that we were out of dining time and could only pick from three very appetizer dip like options. We had 15 minutes left on our reservation and had to leave. Itâ€™s one thing to try to remove a table that is not eating and drinking. Itâ€™s another thing to literally cut someoneâ€™s meal short and all the tables around us were still eating and drinking. There shouldâ€™ve been no issue with us ordering another $50 entrÃ©e.

Customer service matters.
Amazing food
Exceptional! One of my new favorite restaurants

I wish this place was good, but We couldn't find what we're looking for and Price that we paid absolutely does not match the quality we get from the food,

Some dishes tasted really but others tasted like nothing , flavorless or flat.

They did good job with adding spices to tahini and other sauces and dressings, but again not all dishes.....

Waiter was not able focus or answer our all questions , They were just rushing,  running....

Our experience was just okay, May be but may be can come back just for specific dishes hope they can keep their tastes good
Amazing culinary experience here! All dishes had so many unique flavors, the staff was truly so lovely and inviting
The Wagyu kebab is something else. It is an experience! One of best bites on the entire planet!
I didnâ€™t even know food could taste like this.   A top 5, probably top 2, meal Iâ€™ve had in NYC.

Amazing food! It was so fresh, unique and delicious. Would go again to try the other things on the menu. Service was great, atmosphere 4/5 for the great music, with a slight improvement that could be made in the decor to perfect the ambiance.

Holey Moley! this place is INCREDIBLE!!! You'll notice good feeling everywhere. You'll find Eyval offers fair value and vegetable abundance. The workers are so pleasant that spending time here is enjoyable. We picked an excellent place to dine.
My wife and I have been to Eyval twice already and the second was even better than the first time. We tried new dishes recommended by our host. One suggestion Try everything on the menu!
Their beef stew is very delicious !

Our experience at Eyval was not great but not bad either

We were waiting more distinct flavors but some dishes was just blend, nothing special

there was nothing special about the saffron crispy rice, it did not tasted even good

Eggplant, octopus dishes was just okay, nothing different than other nyc restaurants unfortunately

beef pieces on skewer did not taste like anything,  just some simple meat, nothing special as well

we did enjoy salad with spicy tahini dressing and chicken with sweet sour almond rice

at last chocolate cake was good but saffron cream triangle dessert was not good, it tasted like a bad rice pudding......

Some dishes are good but paying more than $300 for two persons and not enjoying most of the dishes not a good experience.

There are much better places with better food and cost less.
The best NYC restaurant
I had an amazing experience, the food was great, cocktails and service were all top notch

I am still feeling sick from having dinner with my husband. The servers accidentally served me octopus instead of steak and served me a Diet Coke instead of Coke. I am also in food service and the terrible service combined with the food poisoning that I received from this restaurant last night is a red flag that a health inspector needs to do a walk through and make sure spending a few hundred for dinner to get food poisoned is unacceptable. I did not get treated very well and they continually kicked my chair walking by the whole time and made me feel unwelcome. This was the end of the night so it wasnâ€™t even busy that these type of actions could be understood. I am feeling aches, my stomach is in knots and Iâ€™ve been on the verge of throwing up all day and night since I ate here. BEWARE OF THE EYE VAL (pronounced evil) Persian restaurant. I reach out to them and they declined to comment

I have been to Eyval four times over the past 8 months, often bringing family and friends and making reservations well in advance. The food is uniqueâ€”not typical Iranian cuisine, but an interesting fusion. The atmosphere, however, is often cold and a bit loud. Most of the clientele seems younger and largely unfamiliar with Iranian food.

What disappointed me most was my recent experience. I had made a reservation for six people a month in advance. The day before, I had an out-of-town guest join and asked to add one more seat. I emailed twice, but only on the day of the reservation did I receive a response saying they could not accommodate an additional person. This forced us to change all our plans. I find it very poor service to turn away a repeat customer over one extra seatâ€”something that could reasonably fit at any table.

I am leaving this review because I believe customer service should still matter. Unfortunately, I can no longer recommend this restaurant to friends or family. New York City has many excellent and welcoming dining options, and I would suggest exploring those instead of a place unwilling to show even minimal flexibility for loyal customers.

We had been long waiting for the opportunity to try Eyval, and it turned out to be a delightful experience overall. The ambiance was warm and inviting, and the servers were incredibly friendly and attentive. The food was a mix of good and fantastic.

The lamb ribs were absolutely out of this world. Chenjeh was also fantastic. For both dishes, I would happily give them more than five stars if I could. Koobideh was good, on the upper side of good, I would rate it 4.5 stars. Ghormeh sabzi and tahdig were both below my expectations, I gave them 4 stars.

Overall, the restaurant experience was more of a 4.5 to 4, but I had to choose between 4 and 5 stars, it would definitely be 4. I will definitely return if itâ€™s only for the lamb ribs!
The most delicious bite Iâ€™ve had on my NY visit! These guys know how to host people and make them feel warm. Iâ€™ll be back for literally every dish.

Me and my wife came here after every special occasion in our life during the time we lived in NYC.

Iâ€™m Persian (born and raised) and I can tell you this place is one of the top 5 places I ever had Persian food (including Iran).

Every dish is designed with a so much care and passion, and while absolutely respecting the traditional taste, it is elevated and ornamented in a modern, creative way that makes each meal not just â€œfood", but a whole unique experience.

This restaurant has made a place in our heart, and (if ever) I come back to New York again, reserving a table here would be the absolute first thing I do.

P.S. You have to absolutely try their Ghalieh Mahi.

4th time coming here, came for a birthday. Amazing food and ambiance, servers and other staff are good. This review is for tonight (09/19):
We had a reservation for 3 adults. Last minute, a small child came with us. With no expectations, we were told she couldnâ€™t be accommodate and can go on my lap. No problem. Coincidentally, at the â€œcommunalâ€ table- a nice couple let us use a spare chair they werenâ€™t. I then seated the child. Immediately, the hostess (?) came storming over to prevent the child from sitting there.. a chair that wasnâ€™t even being used, and wouldnâ€™t be used as this couple was the last party of the evening to be seated there.. ROFL!! What a turn off and joke. I insisted I am not moving the kid and this is reaching and she pissed off thank god. We spent hundreds of dollars and tipped well, that was so extra and couldâ€™ve resulted in loss of customers! She was short, heavy, and had yellow/orange toned hair. Not sure her name but would really train her better because that was SO unsettling.

The flavors transport you to their origin. Apart from tasty options, the surroundings are excellent. Swift assistance and pleasant manner. The food introduces flavor pairings I hadn't considered. I'm glad I came across this wonderful restaurant.
At a loss for words. Grab a couple of friends and book a reservation 2 months out.
Awesome coming from an Iranian

This restaurant definitely lived up to the hype. Classic Persian dishes but with a little extra flavor. I would highly recommending trying the scallops, lamb ribs, date salad, whipped  feta with bread, eggplant and koobideh. We tried the main chicken entree too, but found the rice with raisins and cranberries a little too sweet for our liking but the chicken was cooked perfectly. The saffron dessert was also a fave! Would def come back!

Eyval was nothing short of fantastic! This was my first time trying Persian food and I was truly amazed by every dish we tried. The flavor combinations were unique and delicious, with the perfect mix of sweet and savory. We tried both the komaj bread and barbari bread, which had perfect textures of soft and fluffy. The citrus date salad was super refreshing and light with deep flavors from the dressing and dates, which was the perfect appetizer. We decided to try the lamb ribs, octopus kabob, and kabob koobideh as our entrees. The meat for all dishes were amazingly tender and flavorful, with the ribs falling right off the bone and the octopus perfectly chewy. The star of the shows in these dishes however, was the tomato butter that was served on top of the basmati rice in the kabob koobideh! It was so savory without being salty and wish there was more on the plate. I recommend all of these to share!

The interior was simple but beautifully designed, creating a nice ambiance that takes you out of New York City.  As you walk further in, youâ€™re able to view the kitchen where chefs are carefully crafting each dish.

The service was exceptional also! Our server was very attentive to our table, making sure dishes were cleared and plates were swapped out for an easy dining experience. I also mentioned it was my birthday and they served my dessert with candle, which was a very thoughtful gesture.

Overall, this place was the perfect birthday dinner and glad I ventured out to try new food here! We are already thinking about our next visit to try more of their menu as Iâ€™m sure every dish will not disappoint.
Food presentation was awesome, although the flavor is mostly on the sour side, the tahdig was very good but portion size is small. But overall great atmosphere and service!
I had an amazing experience, first time trying this type of cuisine, everything was incredible. Service, Food, drinks and dessertâ€¦ 10/10 ğŸ‘Œ
Amazing experience from food to service and the environment. Keep it up!!

I checked out Eyval in New York and wow â€” it totally hit different. I had their Shirin polo and it was like an instant trip back to my childhood, every bite packed with that nostalgic flavor I didnâ€™t even know I was missing.

Their cocktails?  Seriously on point. And the whole vibe â€” the kind of energy you just donâ€™t get anywhere else. Plus, the staff werenâ€™t just polite, they had that true Iranian hospitality that makes you feel like youâ€™re at a friendâ€™s house, not just a restaurant.Thanks Eyval

I can't say this place is exactly 'authentic', but as someone who grew up around iranian food i love the added flair and contemporary take on the dishes. The food is absolutely amazing. We loved the lamb ribs and the ghorme sabzi. The kashke bademjoon is the best ive ever had! I honestly don't remember a dish I won't recommend. That being said i think the waiters really try and get you to order way more dishes than reasonable. We got 6 dishes for 4 ppl and 2 of them were apps and we were very full, with leftovers.
Great food, incredible staff and yummy drinks! Very well worth the hassle of getting a reservation

@lydieats ğŸ’• Located all the way in Bushwick, Eyval serves Persian delights that are worth the train ride. First time trying Persian so heavily relied on reviews and server recs. Kinda tastes like Mediterranean but a bit more spiced?

The mast o musir is a thick yogurt dip that tastes garlicky & sweet. Rly good with the barbari bread. Komaj is a bit softer kinda like dinner roll, would get more of the babari. LOVED the squash ğŸ˜‹ Perfectly roasted to bring out the sweetness!! Pumpkin seeds, pomegranate, and feta all complement each other very well. Lamb was a bit tough so skip that and get the super tender wagyu kabob.

ğŸ’• Barbari Bread $6
ğŸ’• Mast o Musir $9*
ğŸ’• Komaj Bread $5
ğŸ’• Butternut Squash & Feta $18*
ğŸ’• Lamb Ribs $22
ğŸ’• Kabob Chenjeh $28*
ğŸ’• Almond and Pistachio Cake $14

Eyval is by far the best Persian restaurant I have ever been to. The food is absolutely fantasticâ€”each dish feels like a true work of art. Chef Ali is not only an incredibly talented chef but also a wonderful human being and a true artist when it comes to creating unforgettable flavors.

The vibe of the restaurant is unmatched. Everyone who works there is so warm and kindâ€”it feels like being welcomed into one big family where their only goal is to make every guest happy. The energy and atmosphere are just perfect.

This place deserves a Michelin star without question. Everything is made fresh the same day, and you can truly taste that freshness in every single bite.

If youâ€™re looking for an unforgettable dining experience, Eyval is it.

202507

Would rate it over 5 if possible! We celebrated an event here, if you are more than 6, their pre-planned shareable menu is wonderful! Authentic way Persians eat at their own celebration!
An incredible Persian restaurant that truly stands out! From cocktails to desserts, every dish stays true to Persian flavors while adding a creative, elevated twist. The salads, sauces, appetizers, and mains are a burst of tasteâ€”rich, bold, and beautifully balanced. Chef Ali is not only talented but also genuinely kind, and the whole team makes you feel right at home. One of the few Persian spots that truly deserves a Michelin star. A must-try!

This place is awesome! My family and I had the best meal. The menu is made for sharing. Every dish we ordered was the best Iâ€™ve had. The service was great. The team worked together seamlessly. We were not rushed. The dishes were brought out in a timely fashion. Our table was never devoid of food. The drinks were unique and delicious. The vibe was great!

This place is amazing! We went two times in a short period of time since we were thinking about their food and other dishes we haven't tried.
Some of the must tries are: Barbari Bread, Yellow French Bean Borani, Citrus Date & Cabbage Salad, Lamb Ribs, Grilled Scallops, Eggplant.

Good Persian spot in East Williamsburg with tough to get reservations. The bread and dips/sauces were probably our favorite items but everything was delicious. The kebab plate was also more plentiful than we were expecting and tasty.

Tough one here for me, going to have to come back for sure. The tldr - everything is great.

Vibe and service is top notch, grab a reservation and get there early to check out the whole restaurant. The cocktails are spectacular as well.

Food. So the food is really really good. I think that the kabob wasnâ€™t as tender and hot as I expected, maybe it was busy so the plate sat for a bit, I understand. However at these price points I expect it to be close to perfect, especially in this area.

The yogurt + bread combo was out of this world. I liked the saffron chicken, but maybe needed a little more salt or spice to cut through the sweetness of the other ingredients.

Overall very happy and will be back as mentioned.

The food is SOOO good. This was supposed to be a stop during my trip but realized that our rehearsals for our NY performance clashed exactly will Eyval's opening hours. I was super sad so my husband decided to get me take out!! I am SO pleased. He got me photos of the food and the plating is so beautiful. I hope I get to visit NY again just so I can eat at Eyval again haha ..and perhaps next time in person! I got to try the lamb...I don't even know how they made it that good. I loved the dry pomegranates on top. The color is so beautiful too. Tried the salad & the roasted eggplant. Both very yummy. The cardamom chocolate cake was DIVINE!! ğŸ˜
Highly recommend!!!

I was wowed by my experience at Ey-vÃ¡l. This has been one of the best Persian food I have had, they certainly ey-vÃ¡l which is a Farsi(Persian) word that adds positive emphasis to an idea. Iâ€™m surprised they are not in the Michelin guide but Iâ€™m sure they will make it sooner than later.

The service was top notch. Super friendly and professional, fairly fast, knowledgeable about the menu and attentive.

Ambiance was dark, enigmatic, hip, I liked it a lot.

The food, what we came for, was beyond delicious. We started with the Mast o Musir and I gotta admit I have had great ones before and thought it would be hard to beat, but this one goes to the top of the list now. So so creamy, with shallots cut at the perfect size and acidity balanced out.

I continued with a salad( canâ€™t remember its name) and while this was not a truly Persian dish, I loved the modern approach and all the flavors they accomplished on this dish. It was my second favorite dish after the mast o musir.

The lamb ribs were a solid dish. The sauce had the perfect sweetness/acidity as well as spiciness and the barberry on top complemented so sell.

The two kabobs were nicely done but my favorite was the koobideh. This is a personal preference as Iâ€™m more into koodideh than steak kabob. I understand the chenjeh is more premium, but it is just my preference. All in all, the 2 kabobs were 5 out 5 stars.

Tahdig which is one of my favorite Persian dishes and a really simple dish, was perfection in a single bite. That sauce they had the rice on, it was spot on. They made it also so good looking. I loved it.

You canâ€™t leave a Persian restaurant without having Persian ice cream. However, to be honest it didnâ€™t do it for me. There were a few flaws : typical Persian ice cream sandwich is with crispy and thin waffles, this one was with a soggy bread, also the ice cream was not as creamy as it should be. The ice cream sandwich was subpar compared to the high quality of the food I had.

All in all, looking forward to my next time at Ey-vÃ¡l. Please open a location in Miami :)

Wow!! What a meal!! Service, food and atmosphere was 10/10. My partner and I cannot wait to return and try everything on the menu. Definitely do not sleep on this restaurant. Truly not a bad dish was had. The carrots, Wagyu kebab, lamb shank and fava bean app was to die for. I canâ€™t wait to return. The cocktails and dessert were also delicious.

Enjoyed staying in here. Very good foods, kind services, vibe was awesome. From entering the restaurant to leave their doors, enjoyed the every single moment. One of my friend cannot eat lamb but their lamb steak was so good that she asked for more. The vibe and wait staff were very kind and made us happy with all his smiles.

Service. Impeccable. Food. So good it was stupid. Decor and aesthetic. Top tier. You can tell the staff there loves and cares about their job and even if they didnâ€™t, they sure as hell know how to pretend and be professional!! And food is well-plated without slapping on gold flakes and truffles and calling it a day.

Highly recommend to go with a friend and just order everything and share everything to really experience what Eyval has to offer.

Wrapped in genuine warmth and an almost familial hospitality. The multi-room layout offers a dynamic setting, each space imbued with a consistent, inviting energy. The staff is joyful, present, and real, their genuine smiles and eager assistance in seeing you enjoy your meal a rarity.

I started with the komaj bread, soft and fragrant with cumin and turmeric. Perfect on its own or even better when paired with the mast o musir. This strained yogurt laced with pickled shallots and turmeric oil is tangy, silky, sharp. It became my go-to dip for almost everything. The citrus date & cabbage salad arrived with color and crunch. Dates brought chew and oranges brought light. A bit overdressed, yes, but forgivable. The idea was right. Then came the lamb ribs. These were spectacular, fall-off-the-bone tender and rich with a tamarind-date sauce, layered with walnut crunch and bursts of barberry tang. A five-star meat moment. This was, without a doubt, the dish of the night. The tahdig, golden, crispy rice studded with almonds, pistachios, barberries, and candied orange offered a perfect foil for the richer mains. The hashoo mahi, a recommendation from the waiter, showcased well seared, high-quality fish, elevated by a fragrant saffron butter and a sweet pomegranate tamarind glaze. Eyval serves persian food, yes, but it celebrates it as well. Return visits is not a question, but more an inevitability.

I loved the atmosphere and really enjoyed the experience. Very conversation friendly.
Everything we tried was good, but the lamb ribs were my favorite, very flavorful and tender.
The ice cream sandwich was good but the rose water flavor was a bit too strong for my taste.
I tried the Sekanjabin cocktail, it was refreshing but lacked a distinct flavor.
I preferred the Havig cocktail, which had a more unique taste.
Also loved the calligraphy on their menu, and the writings on the placements.
I will go back to try other items on the menu as well.

Sooo so good, probably top 3 meals Iâ€™ve had so far on my trip to nyc

I ordered the mast o musir which was really creamy and tangy; komaj was super light and fluffy; barbari that was more savoury; and the lamb ribs that was fall off the bone tender and incredibly tasty. my only regret for this meal is not being able to order more :(

To top it off, all the staff were incredibly kind and attentive. really had a good time there!
We enjoyed the unique flavour combinations and presentation of our food at Eyvol. The bread and whipped feta, date and citrus salad, eggplant, lamb chops and octopus were the stand our dishes for us.

Went to Eyval with a couple of Persian friends who swore by the placeâ€”and they were absolutely right. The food was great â€”flavorful, fresh, and clearly made with a lot of care. We shared a bunch of dishes, and honestly, everything that hit the table was a win. The kebabs were juicy and the small plates had so much flavor packed into them.

The vibe was really cool tooâ€”lively without being too loud, stylish but not overdone. It felt like a great mix of traditional and modern. Definitely a spot Iâ€™ll be coming back to, and if youâ€™ve got Persian friends who are picky about food (like mine), this is the place to take them.

This place is ideal for both Persian food enthusiasts and newcomers who want to enjoy traditional flavors with a modern touch. Highly recommended for a date night, family dinner, or even a solo treat.

Though not the most convenient location for a midtown manhattanite, the unique flavors of this Persian restaurant make this place worth a visit. We ate primarily vegetarian but did have the short rib which was delicious. Breads and feta dip are a must. Very creative desserts.

Everything about this dinner was PERFECT. Incredible service, and the flavors were out of this world. Honestly canâ€™t wait to come back and try more of the menu. On top of that, itâ€™s super reasonably pricedâ€” for a group of 4, we shared several main dishes, had 3 rounds of bread, 2 different dips, dessert and a drink eachâ€¦ came out to $70/pp. Hard to find this kind of excellence in NYC dining these days tbh but Eyval has it on lock ğŸ’¯ğŸ’¯

It was a great experience from the beginning with the hostess in a very welcoming and friendly demeanor. David was our waiter. He was very knowledgeable, attentive, professional, and positive. I enjoyed the barbari bread dipped with the star of feta spread in a fig jam with basil oil. I loved the kabob Chenjeg, waygu beef- medium. It was perfect. The kabob koobideh with waygu beef and lamb brisket was also very delicious. The rice was light and perfect. The ambiance was excellent, and I love the paper place mats with beautiful quotes.

Everything was great, and I really enjoyed the food. The only downside was the portion sizeâ€”it wasnâ€™t quite enough. We ordered the eggplant and cured yogurt (kashk bademjan), koobideh, chenjeh, and barbaric bread, all of which were excellent.

whipped feta, barbari bread, lamb ribs, and wagyu were extraordinary. saffron half chicken and kabob koobideh were ok but wouldnâ€™t get again.

realllly nice vibe, would especially recommend the high top table res. amazing vibes and noise level was just a taaaad above what i would consider perfect for an intimate convo

i rarely comment on service but service was great â€” wait staff was so friendly and funny.

Dear God this was an amazing meal. Got the warm date salad and the striped sea bass dish with tamarind glaze and I was blown away by both. George took great care of me at the bar and the staff was friendly and the food was just excellent.

Exceeded my expectations in every way. The highlight of our meal was the tender lamb ribs, cooked to perfection with a subtle blend of spices that made each bite melt in your mouth. The freshness of the ingredients was evident in every dish. Husbandâ€™s favorite dish was the sea bass over crab rice.

The service was exceptionalâ€”attentive without being overbearing. The overall experience was a wonderful introduction to Persian cuisine for the family. Our teen kids also loved it!

Incredible food in a stylish and cozy setting.

My favorites were the squash salad and the eggplant. My friend had the lamb ribs and said that they were amazing. Even though the whipped feta was tasty, it wasnâ€™t really whipped, more a block of feta with some veggies on top.

The drinks were also fantastic, the saffron martini is a must!

The staff was attentive and accommodating, as a delay with the trains made us late to our reservation.

Check this spot out for a fancy dinner!
This is one of the best meals I've had in NY. Incredible food, cocktails, and quality. Service and atmosphere 10/10. Eyval is now deemed one of my top 5. We were wowed throughout the entire meal

Fantastic contemporary Persian food. Everything we ordered was spectacular: the date salad, the whipped feta spread (denser than expected with a goat cheese tang), the lamb ribs (so tender), the tahdig, and the 1/2 chicken. Service is friendly and efficient. Can't wait to go back!

We loved our meal here for our Anniversary! The Barbari bread and feta dip were a great starter, but I would definitely recommend at least one piece of bread per person. Lamb ribs were really a highlight, they are quite heavy but the portion isn't gigantic. Also would recommend the cabbage and date salad and the half chicken (which doesn't actually seem to be half a chicken in the way you are probably thinking...It seemed to all be breast meat...but it still enough as a main course for two people if you got smaller plates too).
The drinks were a highlight too, they're Sharbats are really interesting non-alcoholic options. Their cocktail menu had some good house variations on classic drinks, and the Persian tea old fashioned was a really great sipper.
I have dined at Eyval over 20x. Fantastic food every single time. No matter what you order you wonâ€™t be disappointed. Donâ€™t forget to save room for tea and dessert at the end!

Lovely dinner, Matthew our waiter was friendly and upbeat and made great suggestions! a only feedback is that as  someone who doesnâ€™t  eat red meat, some of the flavor profiles were similar. Obsessed with the cabbage salad and stripped bass - both had delicate layered flavors!

Food is absolutely delicious, you cannot go wrong ordering anything off the menu. Been here 3 times now and the lamb ribs, citrus date salad, and octopus have been exquisite!!!! every single time. Reservations are sometimes hard to get but always worth it. Matthew was also the best server and provided amazing service!

This meal really wow-ed my friend and I! Everything was so flavorful, unique and fresh. Our favorites were the honeynut squash salad, lamb ribs, and the eggplant but everything was superb. Staff was very kind and friendly and the restaurant was so cute inside. Would definitely come back!!

Did a walk in, had the seat at the bar. Nice atmosphere. Had barbari bread and the dip as a starter, it was insanely delicious!!!
